name: Punk City 2086
description:
Punk city 2086 is just an experiment. A technical demo for me to test out different procedural city generation methods and basic navigation AI. The city is generated in real time by placing a small random amount of hub towers, then connecting them via a road network, then expanding the road network by drawing perpendicular segments and finally placing buildings on the sides of the road segments.

Once the first building is placed, a traffic system comes into play, hovercars are spawned inside the garages where they fly out and proceed to navigate to a random garage, once they reach the entrance of the target garage, if this is not busy, they'll proceed to dock and leave the scene.

Controls:
H - shows hide the UI
Space - switch camera between overview and chase
Tab - switch the POV to a different hovercar
P - spawns a player controlled hovercar

W - Accelerate player hovercar
Mouse - Steer player hovercar

Vehicles were made using AssetForge
Buildings were made using Sketchup
Fantastic music downloaded from Bensound
https://www.bensound.com/royalty-free-music/track/sci-fi
